# Introduction {#intro}

Mortgage bonds have a long history in Denmark, originating from 1797 where a fire in Copenhagen destroyed most of the city in 1795, this event initiated the first mortgage bank[@jensen2013rentesregning]. The general idea on how the mortgage system in Denmark has since only seen minor changes thus a source of high stability. The idea being the system that instead of having a one-to-one relationship between the borrower mortgage loan and the investors mortgage bond. The Danish mortgage system is structured such that the mortgage bond issuer pools the mortgage loan \@ref(fig:bondCashFlow)
